answers.answer: I had one, and mine went perfect. The reason I got one is I was delivering 5 weeks early due to preeclampsia. They induced me, but I just want ready. It helped so much with the pain. Don't feel guilty if you have to get one. I will say though, try to hold off as long as possible though because after you get one, you can't get up anymore. I've heard it's ideal to try to wait until your like dilated to a 7. But if you can't do it, go ahead and go for it.

I didn't have one with my first baby. I'm terrified of needles so getting the IV was bad enough. And just like any medicine, the epidural has potential side effects and that scares me, I try to avoid taking any medicine unless I have to! I'm getting induced with this baby on Saturday and I am going to try not to get one, but things don't always go as planned so I may get one if the pain is too much.

I had an epidural. With my first. And it went great i barley. Felt it and it blocked feeling. From my waste down.i couldn't. Imagin having. A baby without epidural. I was  relaxed and pain free.im definitely. Getting. It again. With my next

I had the epidural with no side effects afterwards - the only thing is it wore off VERY quickly and I had to have it topped up 4 Times, and even then it wore off as I was pushing anyway! But I would definitely have it again!

I just can't believe people rely on an epidural like they do. The woman's body was made for child birth and should be able to do it. Just think about it going into your body, it has to affect the baby In some way? That baby has to feel something. I will never get one because of the side affects. Every person I know that had one sill gets back pain from it and a few people had to go into the emergency room because they had a nonstop headache from the time they got it.

Interventions lead to more interventions, epidurals increase the chances of needing an emergency c-sections, I would never judge a woman for getting one of they feel it's best for them if they can't cope, but I don't understand why a woman would go into labour with the idea of getting one...birth should be as natural as possible and interventions should be only when necessary- that's my opinion :)
I had one and LOVED it!!! No side effects whatsoever and I barely felt it when they put it in.

I've never had an epidural so I can't speak from experience, but everyone I know that has had one is telling me not to get one. They all suffer from chronic back pain, some of them didn't experience it right away, but a few years later the back pain comes, and they all said it either didn't work or it only helped with the contractions but not with the actual pushing. I'm not planning on getting an epidural, but it's a personal choice so it's up to the individual. Some women loved it and some hated it.

Same here ive heard good stories and bad i did hear though that drinking a coke helps with the headache not sure how true that is! though either way im having my first child in may and i will wait as long as i possibly can hopefully i can go without for a fast recovery!

I had one for a cerclage not labor, but it sucked! Yes it numbs you, completely then you are stuck in a single position for hours unless someone moves you, not to mention it hurt bad! I have preexisting back issues that complicated things a bit and for a week after i was bruised and in so much pain, not worth it in my opinion

Its by all means up to the individual. But might I add that the drugs that you put in your body do have an affect on your baby, it can make them sluggish which in turn can make your labor longer or lead to a c-section, he/she may also have a harder time nursing at first. This is NOT meant to scare you! Lol  I have just done some reading up on it, and have seen that an epidural can and does affect the baby though it may not always be in a major way. But like it was said already it totally up to you!

question: First time mommy here and I hear so many horror stories of epidurals. What's your thoughts on it?
title: epidural
